item.title: World Map Made of Hexagons - Geographic Pattern Map Design
item.description: A map of the world with the landmasses made up of hexagons rendered in the Winkel tripel projection.

item.title: Berlin Rails, Roads and Water - Dark Geographic Map Design
item.description: A map of the city of Berlin, Germany and surroundings showing railways and roads in light gray and water in blue on a dark background created with data from OpenStreetMap.

item.title: World Map of Large Rivers, Lakes and Coast Lines - Dark Background
item.description: This design shows a map of the world with large rivers, lakes and coast lines drawn in a blue color and a dark background using the robinson map projection.

item.title: World Map of Large Rivers, Lakes and Coast Lines - Dark Background
item.description: This design shows a map of the world with large rivers, lakes and coast lines drawn in a blue color and a dark background using the robinson map projection.

item.title: World Map of Large Rivers, Lakes and Coast Lines - Dark Background
item.description: This design shows a map of the world with large rivers, lakes and coast lines drawn in a blue color and a dark background using the robinson map projection.

item.title: Vintage Style Map of the Caribbean/Central America
item.description: The Caribbean consists of the Caribbean Sea, its islands and some bordering ones as well as the surrounding coasts. The region is southeast of the Gulf of Mexico and the North American mainland, east of Central America, and north of South America. This vintage style map shows the Caribbean in brown and orange colors with current country names displayed in a script font along with illustrations of ships, sword fish and a compass.

item.title: Grid of World Land Area Maps in 48 Projections with Graticule
item.description: This design consists of a 8x6 grid of 48 different map projections of earth's landmass printed in black with a gray graticule overlay. The included map projections are listed below: * Azimuthal Equidistant * Airy * Aitoff * Boggs Eumorphic * Bonne (Werner lat_1=90) * Cassini * Equal Area Cylindrical * Eckert I * Eckert II * Eckert III * Eckert IV * Eckert V * Eckert VI * Equidistant Cylindrical (Plate Caree) * Gall (Gall Stereographic) * Geocentric * Gilbert Two World Perspective * General Sinusoidal Series * Kavraisky VII * Lambert Azimuthal Equal Area * Lambert Equal Area Conic * Lat/long (Geodetic) * Loximuthal * McBryde-Thomas Flat-Polar Sinusoidal * Mercator * Miller Cylindrical * Mollweide * Natural Earth * Natural Earth 2 * Nell-Hammer * Oblique Cylindrical Equal Area * Polyconic (American) * Putnins P1 * Robinson * Sinusoidal (Sanson-Flamsteed) * Transverse Cylindrical Equal Area * Times * van der Grinten III * Wagner I (Kavraisky VI) * Wagner II * Wagner III * Wagner IV * Wagner V * Wagner VI * Wagner VII * Winkel I * Winkel II * Winkel Tripel The full design is displayed on posters. The design is clipped on some products such as mugs, phone wallets or throw pillows so it fits them well, but doesn't show all 48 projections. The maps were created from the Land polygons with major islands shapefile from "Natural Earth":http://www.naturalearthdata.com/.

item.title: New York Roads and Railways Map
item.description: This map is drawn from roads and railways of the New York metropolitan area as of October 10, 2016. The road and railway location data was extracted from "OpenStreetMap":http://www.openstreetmap.org/ and provided by "Mapzen":https://mapzen.com/.

item.title: World map in brown on a scratched green/brownish background
item.description: This design is available exclusively on phone cases. It consists of a world map in the Robinson projection printed in a semi-transparent brown on a scratched green/brownish background.

item.title: Orange/Red World Map on Blue/Black Backround in Waterman Projection
item.description: A map of the world with the countries colored in different orange/red hues, the see in blue on a black canvas. The map is rendered in the Waterman "Butterfly" projection and was created with D3js and Inkscape.
